element.name: Knocksink Riverbend by daraconn, Traditional Cache (2/2.5)
element.description: Small cache hidden in Knocksink Wood Nature Reserve. This cache is on the south side of the Glencullen River. The trail is muddy so good boots are recommended.

long-description.p: Knocksink Wood Nature Reserve is near Enniskerry Village, on the banks of the Glencullen River. This stretch of river is particularly scenic, with torrents, small cascades and miniature gorges. Care is needed, especially with small children, as there are some steep drops.

These woods are rich in plant and animal life, and shelter diverse habitats within a relatively small area. Please note that this area is a Nature Reserve, so particular care should be taken to observe the principles of Leave No Trace, and to refrain from harming or disturbing the plants and animals.
long-description.br:
Special thanks to the National Parks and Wildlife Service for their kind permission to place the cache.
Parking:
Evenings and weekends - parking is available off the road at the main entrance gate
Weekdays - you may drive in to the car park, keeping in mind that the gate will be locked at 5:30 pm Public Transport: Bus number 44 will bring you from Dublin to Enniskerry. Ask the driver for Knocksink Woods, which is just before Enniskerry Village. Bus number 185 will bring you from Bray Dart Station to Enniskerry. It's half a kilometre from Enniskerry village to the main gate.
Safety note: when you approach the cache location along the path, you will not need to descend (towards the river) or ascend to reach the cache. With the river on your left, the cache is on the right (safe) side of the path. Please be aware of the steep drop.
Please replace the cache exactly where you found it, tucked away out of sight.

element.additional-waypoints:
CP1B6B5 - Car Park
N 53° 11.892 W 006° 10.707
Main car park. Open weekdays until 5.30.
EN1B6B5 - Main Entrance of Knocksink Woods
N 53° 11.732 W 006° 10.432
Main Entrance of Knocksink Woods. Park here at weekends or evenings.
element.encoded-hints: Behind tree roots, 6 ft above path.

ul.li:
2010-05-30T19:00:00Z : Found it by Serapis
A quick find in the end, will move the GC on. Great walk on a very sunny afternoon.

2010-05-30T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by oldnavycarl
We had no luck with this one - thought it was quite a tough one! Maybe we will have to try this again with a better device :-( but it is really nice place. I have added some pictures but since we didnt find the cache dont use my pictures for hints!

2010-04-29T15:12:35Z : Found it by edwincartwright
First one for me in ireland. Not an easy find cause i took the direct way. More rewarding though. In: geocoin. Tftc!

2010-04-28T19:00:00Z : Found it by edwincartwright
Forgot to register the geocoin. Please take it and drop it elsewhere.
Regards,
Edwin.

2010-04-22T19:00:00Z : Found it by kaputing
Wow, I've passed here for years and never gone in. What a gem. Definitely took the hard way to get here. Only when we found the cache did we discover the easy path. Lots of fun though. Will be back to do the whole circuit. TFTC

wpt.name: GC1B6B5

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Knocksink Riverbend
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:short_description: Small cache hidden in Knocksink Wood Nature Reserve. This cache is on the south side of the Glencullen River. The trail is muddy so good boots are recommended.
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
Knocksink Wood Nature Reserve is near Enniskerry Village, on the banks of the Glencullen River. This stretch of river is particularly scenic, with torrents, small cascades and miniature gorges. Care is needed, especially with small children, as there are some steep drops.

These woods are rich in plant and animal life, and shelter diverse habitats within a relatively small area. Please note that this area is a Nature Reserve, so particular care should be taken to observe the principles of Leave No Trace, and to refrain from harming or disturbing the plants and animals.


Special thanks to the National Parks and Wildlife Service for their kind permission to place the cache.

Parking:

  • Evenings and weekends - parking is available off the road at the main entrance gate
  • Weekdays - you may drive in to the car park, keeping in mind that the gate will be locked at 5:30 pm
Public Transport: Bus number 44 will bring you from Dublin to Enniskerry. Ask the driver for Knocksink Woods, which is just before Enniskerry Village. Bus number 185 will bring you from Bray Dart Station to Enniskerry. It's half a kilometre from Enniskerry village to the main gate.

Safety note: when you approach the cache location along the path, you will not need to descend (towards the river) or ascend to reach the cache. With the river on your left, the cache is on the right (safe) side of the path. Please be aware of the steep drop.

Please replace the cache exactly where you found it, tucked away out of sight.

Additional Waypoints

N 53° 11.892 W 006° 10.707
Main car park. Open weekdays until 5.30.
EN1B6B5 - Main Entrance of Knocksink Woods
N 53° 11.732 W 006° 10.432
Main Entrance of Knocksink Woods. Park here at weekends or evenings.
